definitions.definition: A statistical measure defined as Cov ⁡ ( X , Y ) = E ⁡ ( ( X − μ ) ( Y − ν ) ) {\displaystyle \scriptstyle \operatorname {Cov} (X,Y)=\operatorname {E} ((X-\mu )(Y-\nu ))} given two real -valued random variables X and Y , with expected values E ( X ) = μ {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(X)\,=\,\mu } and E ( Y ) = ν {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(Y)\,=\,\nu } .
The conversion of data types from wider to narrower in certain situations.

main_definition: ( statistics ) A statistical measure defined as Cov ⁡ ( X , Y ) = E ⁡ ( ( X − μ ) ( Y − ν ) ) {\displaystyle \scriptstyle \operatorname {Cov} (X,Y)=\operatorname {E} ((X-\mu )(Y-\nu ))} given two real -valued random variables X and Y , with expected values E ( X ) = μ {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(X)\,=\,\mu } and E ( Y ) = ν {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(Y)\,=\,\nu } .
secondary_definitions: ( object-oriented programming ) The conversion of data types from wider to narrower in certain situations.
